sen.j: 京都大学新聞社（きょうとだいがくしんぶんしゃ）は、京都大学の学生新聞である『京都大学新聞』（通称『京大新聞』）や関連書籍などを発行するサークル・京都大学公認団体。
sen.e: Kyoto University Press is a circle certified by Kyoto University for publishing Kyoto University's student press "Kyoto University Press" (commonly known as "Kyodai Press") and other related publications.

Kyoto University Press is a circle certified by Kyoto University for publishing Kyoto University's student press "Kyoto University Press" (commonly known as "Kyodai Press") and other related publications.

Kyoto University Press is a circle certified by Kyoto University for publishing Kyoto University's student press "Kyoto University Press" (commonly known as "Kyodai Press") and other related publications.

sen.j: 略称は「KUP」（英文名Kyoto University Pressから）。
sen.e: Its acronym is 'KUP' (from the English name of Kyoto University Press).
Its acronym is 'KUP' (from the English name of Kyoto University Press).
Its acronym is 'KUP' (from the English name of Kyoto University Press).

sen.j: 京都大学構内に本拠を置く、唯一の学生新聞団体として活動する。
sen.e: It operates as the only student press organization that is based in Kyoto University campus.
It operates as the only student press organization that is based in Kyoto University campus.
It operates as the only student press organization that is based in Kyoto University campus.

sen.j: 『京大学生新聞』を発行する京大学生新聞会（原理研究会系）、『京都大学EXPRESS』を発行する京都大学EXPRESS編集部（UNN関西学生報道連盟加盟）とは全く関係ない。
sen.e: It has absolutely no relations to Kyoto University Student Times (Collegiate Association for the Research of Principles group) that publishes "Kyoto University Student Times" and Kyoto University EXPRESS Editorial Desk (UNN University News Network member) that publishes "Kyoto University EXPRESS".

It has absolutely no relations to Kyoto University Student Times (Collegiate Association for the Research of Principles group) that publishes "Kyoto University Student Times" and Kyoto University EXPRESS Editorial Desk (UNN University News Network member) that publishes "Kyoto University EXPRESS."

It has absolutely no relations to Kyoto University Student Times (Collegiate Association for the Research of Principles group) that publishes "Kyoto University Student Times" and Kyoto University EXPRESS Editorial Desk (UNN University News Network member) that publishes "Kyoto University EXPRESS."

sen.j: 京都帝国大学の全学親睦組織・学友会（会長は総長）の新聞部として1925年結成、4月1日創刊。
sen.e: It was established in 1925 as a newspaper division of the students institute, a shinboku organization for all grades (whose chairman being the president) of Kyoto Imperial University, with its first publication on April 1st.

It was established in 1925 as a newspaper division of the students institute, a shinboku organization for all grades (whose chairman being the president) of Kyoto Imperial University, with its first publication on April 1st.

It was established in 1925 as a newspaper division of the students institute, a shinboku organization for all grades (whose chairman being the president) of Kyoto Imperial University, with its first publication on April 1st.

sen.j: 前年に行なわれた東京帝国大学とのスポーツ交流戦を雑誌部が試験的に報じたことを機に、大学新聞発行の機運が高まったことによる。
sen.e: This came about as publication of university press gathered momentum with the magazine division's experimental reporting of the sports interleague games against Tokyo Imperial University held the previous year.

This came about as publication of university press gathered momentum with the magazine division's experimental reporting of the sports interleague games against Tokyo Imperial University held the previous year.

This came about as publication of university press gathered momentum with the magazine division's experimental reporting of the sports interleague games against Tokyo Imperial University held the previous year.

sen.j: 学友会雑誌部を改組・改廃し、元読売新聞社員の入山雄一を顧問に迎えて組織された。
sen.e: It was organized by welcoming Yuichi IRIYAMA, a former employee of the Yomiuri Shimbun, as an adviser, with revision and abolition of the students institute magazine division.
It was organized by welcoming Yuichi IRIYAMA, a former employee of the Yomiuri Shimbun, as an adviser, with revision and abolition of the students institute magazine division.
It was organized by welcoming Yuichi IRIYAMA, a former employee of the Yomiuri Shimbun, as an adviser, with revision and abolition of the students institute magazine division.

sen.j: 初代部長は佐々木惣一教授（当時）。
sen.e: The first division head was Professor (at the time) Soichiro SASAKI.
The first division head was Professor (at the time) Soichiro SASAKI.
The first division head was Professor (at the time) Soichiro SASAKI.

sen.j: 当初は大学の機関紙として当局の広報活動を担ったが、1946年に独立採算化。
sen.e: At first, it bore public relations activities of the school authorities as the university's official publication, but in 1946 it took on an independent accounting system.
At first, it bore public relations activities of the school authorities as the university's official publication, but in 1946 it took on an independent accounting system.
At first, it bore public relations activities of the school authorities as the university's official publication, but in 1946 it took on an independent accounting system.

sen.j: 大学側も1972年、事務方の庶務部に広報調査課（現在の秘書・広報課）を設置するに至った。
sen.e: In 1972, the university ended up establishing public relations research department (the current secretary and public relations department) in the General Affairs Division which administered clerical works.

In 1972, the university ended up establishing public relations research department (the current secretary and public relations department) in the General Affairs Division which administered clerical works.

In 1972, the university ended up establishing public relations research department (the current secretary and public relations department) in the General Affairs Division which administered clerical works.

sen.j: 新聞を核に書籍も発行し、各種シンポジウム・講演会を主催するなど、学生による総合メディアとして発展。
sen.e: It has developed as student's multimedia, publishing newspapers as well as book, and sponsoring various symposiums and lecture presentations.
It has developed with student's multimedia, publishing newspapers as well as books, and sponsoring various symposiums and lecture presentations.
It has developed as a creator of student-produced multimedia, publishing newspapers as well as books, and sponsoring various symposiums and lecture presentations.
sen.cmt: as が with に訂正されていますが、「総合メディアとして発展」なので as にして訳し直しました。

sen.j: マスコミ・学界・産業界などに人材を輩出してきた。
sen.e: It has produced talents to the worlds of mass media, academic, and industrial.
It has produced talents to the worlds of mass media, academic, and industrial.
It has produced talents to the worlds of mass media, academic, and industrial.

sen.j: 1997年には「京都大学新聞社新人文学賞」を主催、吉村萬壱（6年後に芥川賞受賞）の『国営巨大浴場の午後』が受賞した。
sen.e: In 1997, it sponsored the 'Kyoto University Press Literary Prize for New Writers Award' and awarded Manichi YOSHIMURA's "Afternoon at the Government-managed Giant Bathhouse" (YOSHIMURA received Akutagawa Award 6 years later).

In 1997, it sponsored the 'Kyoto University Press Literary Prize for New Writers Award' and awarded Manichi YOSHIMURA's "Afternoon at the Government-managed Giant Bathhouse" (YOSHIMURA received Akutagawa Award 6 years later).

In 1997, it sponsored the 'Kyoto University Press Literary Prize for New Writers Award' and awarded Manichi YOSHIMURA's "Afternoon at the Government-managed Giant Bathhouse" (Yoshimura received Akutagawa Award six years later).
sen.cmt: YOSHIMURA（二度目）→Yoshimura 数字表記変更

sen.j: 媒体としては、前身の『京都帝國大學新聞』は1925年に創刊。
sen.e: In terms of media, the predecessor "Kyoto Imperial University Press" was first published in 1925.
In terms of media, the predecessor "Kyoto Imperial University Press" was first published in 1925.
In terms of media, the predecessor "Kyoto Imperial University Press" was first published in 1925.

sen.j: 戦中の物資不足などから1944年『帝國大學新聞（現在の東京大学新聞の前身）』と合併し『大學新聞』と改題。
sen.e: Due to wartime shortages, it merged with the "Kyoto Imperial University Press (predecessor to the present-day Tokyo University Press)" in 1944 under the new title of "University Press".
Due to wartime shortages, it merged with the "Kyoto Imperial University Press (predecessor to the present-day Tokyo University Press)" in 1944 under the new title of "University Press."
Due to wartime shortages, it merged with the "Imperial University Press (predecessor to the present-day Tokyo University Press)" in 1944 under the new title of "University Press."

sen.j: 戦後1946年4月には『大學新聞』から分離し『學園新聞』と改題、関西一円の学生を対象に発行された。
sen.e: After the war, it separated from "University Press" by April of 1946, and under the new title of "Gakuen Press", it was published with the whole Kansai area students as its target.
After the war, it separated from "University Press" by April of 1946, and under the new title of "Gakuen Press," it was published with the whole Kansai area students as its target.
After the war, it separated from "University Press" by April of 1946, and under the new title of "Gakuen Press," it was published with the whole Kansai area students as its target.

sen.j: 1959年に『京都大学新聞』と改題し、以後現在に至るまで発行を続けている。
sen.e: In 1959, it changed the title to "Kyoto University Press" and has continued publication to this day.
In 1959, it changed its title to "Kyoto University Press" and has continued publication to this day.
In 1959, it changed its title to "Kyoto University Press" and has continued publication to this day.

sen.j: 2007年5月、通算2400号を数えた。
sen.e: In May of 2007, it counted a total of 2400 issues.
In May of 2007, it counted a total of 2400 issues.
In May of 2007, it counted a total of 2400 issues.

sen.j: 組織の歴史
sen.e: History of the Organization
History of the Organization
History of the Organization

sen.j: 1925年（大正14年）「学友会新聞部」として結成、時計台内に事務所を置く
sen.e: In 1925, it was formed as 'Student Institutes Press Division' and held office in the clock tower.
sen.cmt: 「学友会新聞部」を 'Student Institutes Press Division' としました。
sen.e: In 1925, it was formed as 'Student Institutes Press Division' and held office in the clock tower.
1925: It was formed as 'Student Institutes Press Division' and held office in the clock tower.

sen.j: 1935年（昭和10年）「インテル会」発足
sen.e: In 1935, the 'Interu-kai Foundation' was founded.
sen.cmt: 「インテル会」を 'Interu-kai Foundation' としました。
sen.e: In 1935, the 'Interu-kai Foundation' was founded.
1935: The 'Interu-kai Foundation' was founded.

sen.j: 1941年（昭和16年）学友会の改名に伴い「同学会新聞部」へ改名
sen.e: In 1941, with the change in the title for the students institute, it changed its title to 'Dogakukai Press Division'.
sen.cmt: 「同学会新聞部」を 'Dogakukai Press Division' としました。
sen.e: In 1941, with the change in the title for the students institute, it changed its title to 'Dogakukai Press Division.'
1941: With the change in the title for the students institute, it changed its title to 'Dogakukai Press Division.'

sen.j: 1944年（昭和19年）帝国大学新聞社と合併し「社団法人大学新聞社関西支社」へ改組
sen.e: In 1944, it merged with Imperial University Press and reorganized as 'University Press Corporation Kansai Branch Office'.
In 1944, it merged with Imperial University Press and reorganized as 'University Press Corporation Kansai Branch Office.'
1944: It merged with Imperial University Press and reorganized as 'University Press Corporation Kansai Branch Office.'

sen.j: 1946年（昭和21年）同法人から分離し「京都大学新聞社」へ改組、独立採算化
sen.e: In 1946, it saparated from the said corporation and reorganized as 'Kyoto University Press' and took on an independent accounting system.
In 1946, it separated from the said corporation and reorganized as 'Kyoto University Press' and took on an independent accounting system.
1946: It separated from the said corporation and reorganized as 'Kyoto University Press' and took on an independent accounting system.

sen.j: 1949年（昭和24年）入学試験の合格電報事務を開始
sen.e: In 1949, it started a telegram office for candidates passing the entrance examination.
In 1949, it started a telegram office for candidates passing the entrance examination.
1949: It started a telegram office for candidates passing the entrance examination.

sen.j: 1950年（昭和25年）編集長と鳥養利三郎総長（当時）が交換協定に調印し、大学の公認を取得
sen.e: In 1950, the chief editor and Risaburo TORIGAI who was the president (at the time) signed an exchange agreement, and it gained the official recognition of the university.
In 1950, the chief editor and Risaburo TORIGAI who was the president (at the time) signed an exchange agreement, and it gained the official recognition of the university.
1950: The chief editor and Risaburo TORIGAI who was the president (at the time) signed an exchange agreement, and it gained the official recognition of the university.

sen.j: 1970年（昭和45年）全日本学生新聞連盟（＝全学新）第25回大会が京都大学で開催され、京都大学新聞社の吉澤潔が新委員長に選出される。
sen.e: In 1970, The 25th Convention of University Press Union (known as Zengakushin) was held, and Kiyoshi YOSHIZAWA of Kyoto University Press was elected as the new chairman.
In 1970, The 25th Convention of University Press Union (known as Zengakushin) was held, and Kiyoshi YOSHIZAWA of Kyoto University Press was elected as the new chairman.
1970: The 25th Convention of University Press Union (known as Zengakushin) was held at Kyoto University, and Kiyoshi YOSHIZAWA of Kyoto University Press was elected as the new chairman.
sen.cmt: 「京都大学で」 訳漏れ対応しました。

sen.j: 全国の大学新聞、75団体が参加（うち13団体は議長委任）。
sen.e: Of the university presses nationwide, 75 organizations participated (and of those, 13 organizations were chairperson delegated).
Of the university presses nationwide, 75 organizations participated (and of those, 13 organizations were delegated as chairpersons).

sen.j: 媒体の歴史
sen.e: History of the Media
History of the Media

sen.j: 1925年（大正14年）『京都帝國大學新聞』創刊
sen.e: In 1925, "Kyoto Imperial University Press" was first published.

sen.j: 1944年（昭和19年）帝國大學新聞と合併し『大學新聞』と改題
sen.e: In 1944, it merged with Imperial University Press and changed its title to "University Press".
In 1944, it merged with Imperial University Press and changed its title to "University Press."

sen.j: 1946年（昭和21年）「大學新聞」から分離し『學園新聞』と改題、旬刊
sen.e: In 1946, it saparated from 'University Press' and changed the title to "Gakuen Press"; it was issued every 10 days.
sen.cmt: *『学園新聞』を "Gakuen Press" としました。
sen.e: In 1946, it separated from 'University Press' and changed its title to "Gakuen Press;" it was issued every 10 days.

sen.j: 1947年（昭和22年 6月11日号より週刊へ移行
sen.e: In 1947, it changed to weekly publication from the June 11th issue.
In 1947, it changed to weekly publication from the June 11th issue.
1947: It changed to weekly publication from the June 11th issue.

sen.j: 1959年（昭和34年）通算1000号を期に『京都大学新聞』と改題
sen.e: In 1959, with the total issue reaching 1000, it changed the title to "Kyoto University Press".
In 1959, with the total issue reaching 1000, it changed its title to "Kyoto University Press."
1959: With the total issue reaching 1000, it changed its title to "Kyoto University Press."

sen.j: 1965年（昭和40年）40周年記念事業として『京都大学卒業者人名録』を発行
sen.e: In 1965, it published "Kyoto University Graduates Directory" as a forty years memorial project.
sen.cmt: 『京都大学卒業者人名録』を "Kyoto University Graduates Directory" としました。また、用語にある「40周年」の訳が他の「X周年」と若干異なったものとなっています。
sen.e: In 1965, it published "Kyoto University Graduates Directory" as a forty years memorial project.
1965: It published "Kyoto University Graduates Directory" as a 40th anniversary project.
sen.cmt: E欄で指摘されてますが、anniversary が多く使われるようですので変更しました。

sen.j: 1969年（昭和44年）創刊45周年事業として縮刷版の発行開始
sen.e: In 1969, it began publication of a scaled-down edition as a 45th anniversary project.
In 1969, it began publication of a scaled-down edition as a 45th anniversary project.
1969: It began publication of a scaled-down edition as a 45th anniversary project.

sen.j: 1970年（昭和45年）通算1500号記念号（特大40頁）を発行
sen.e: In 1970, it published a memorial issue (enlarged 40 pages) for the total issue reaching 1500.
In 1970, it published a memorial issue (enlarged 40 pages) for the total number of issues reaching 1500.
1970: It published a memorial issue (enlarged 40 pages) for the total number of issues reaching 1500.

sen.j: 1985年（昭和60年）60周年記念事業として『口笛と軍靴 天皇制ファシズムの相貌』を発行
sen.e: In 1985, it published "The Whistle and the Military Boots: Physiognomy of the Emperor System Fascism" as a 60th anniversary memorial project.
In 1985, it published "The Whistle and the Military Boots: Physiognomy of the Emperor System Fascism" as a 60th anniversary memorial project.
1985: It published "The Whistle and the Military Boots: Physiognomy of the Emperor System Fascism" as a 60th anniversary memorial project.

sen.j: 1988年（昭和63年）大学創立90周年記念誌『京大史記』に編集・執筆協力
sen.e: In 1988, it collaborated in editing and writing for the memorial magazine "Records of Kyoto University" for the 90th anniversary of foundation of the university.
In 1988, it collaborated in editing and writing for the memorial magazine "Records of Kyoto University" for the 90th anniversary of foundation of the university.
1988: It collaborated in editing and writing for the memorial magazine "Records of Kyoto University" for the 90th anniversary of foundation of the university.

sen.j: 2005年（平成17年）80周年記念事業として80周年記念号（特大10頁）を発行
sen.e: In 2005, it published 80th anniversary memorial issue (enlarged 10 pages) as an 80th anniversary memorial project.
In 2005, it published 80th anniversary memorial issue (enlarged 10 pages) as an 80th anniversary memorial project.
2005: It published an 80th anniversary memorial issue (enlarged 10 pages) as an 80th anniversary memorial project.
sen.cmt: 初めの80thの前に冠詞をつけました。

sen.j: 2006年（平成18年）4月1日号より紙面を「大学・総合」「教育・研究」「文化・生活」の各面に編成
sen.e: In 2006, it organized the page space to 'University and General Matters', 'Education and Research', and 'Culture and Life' pages from the April 1st issue.
In 2006, it organized the page space into 'University and General Matters,' 'Education and Research,' and 'Culture and Life' pages from the April 1st issue.
2006: It organized the page space into 'University and General Matters,' 'Education and Research,' and 'Culture and Life' pages from the April 1st issue.

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）紙面の数字表記を漢数字主体から洋数字主体へ移行
sen.e: In 2007, it changed the numeric notation shown in the page space to mainly European numerals from mainly Chinese characters which expressed numbers.
In 2007, it changed the numeric notation shown in the page space to mainly European numerals from mainly Chinese characters which expressed numbers.

sen.j: 新聞は現在、原則として月2回発行（1日号・16日号、通常4ページ）となっており1部100円。
sen.e: Currently, the newspaper is generally published twice a month (day 1st issue, day 16th issue; usually 4 pages), and the price is 100 yen per copy.
Currently, the newspaper is generally published twice a month (day 1st issue, day 16th issue; usually 4 pages), and the price is 100 yen per copy.

sen.j: 学内7箇所（正門・北西門・西部ルネ・中央食堂・北部食堂・吉田食堂・総人図書館）の販売BOXで購読できるほか、全国の定期購読者に発送している。
sen.e: It can be purchased at sales box found at 7 locations within the university (main gate, north-west gate, western Renai, central cafeteria, northern cafeteria, Yoshida cafeteria, and Library of Graduate School of Human and Environmental Studies), and it is also sent out to subscribers nationwide.

It can be purchased at sales boxes found at 7 locations within the university (main gate, north-west gate, western Renai, central cafeteria, northern cafeteria, Yoshida cafeteria, and Library of Graduate School of Human and Environmental Studies), and it is also sent out to subscribers nationwide.

It can be purchased at sales boxes found at 7 locations within the university (main gate, north-west gate, western Renai, central cafeteria, northern cafeteria, Yoshida cafeteria, and Library of Graduate School of Human and Environmental Studies), and it is also sent out to subscribers nationwide.

sen.j: 毎年秋には「高校生特集号」、冬には「二次試験特集号」などの特集号を発行し、号外（七大戦結果、石垣カフェ騒動など）も適時発行している。
sen.e: It publishes special issues every year, such as 'High School Students Special Issue' in the fall and 'Secondary Exam Special Issue' in the winter, and also publishes extra editions (for such as National 7 Universities General Athletic Meet result and stone wall cafe riot) in a timely fashion.
sen.cmt: 七大戦=全国七大学総合体育大会 を National 7 Universities General Athletic Meet としました。
sen.e: It publishes special issues every year, such as 'High School Students Special Issue' in the fall and 'Secondary Exam Special Issue' in the winter, and also publishes extra editions (such as National 7 Universities General Athletic Meet results and stone wall cafe riot) in a timely fashion.

It publishes special issues every year, such as 'High School Students Special Issue' in the fall and 'Secondary Exam Special Issue' in the winter, and also publishes extra editions (such as National 7 Universities General Athletic Meet results and stone wall cafe riot) in a timely fashion.

sen.j: 印刷・発送以外の全て（レイアウトを含む）が学生の手によること、分析記事が多いことなどが特色である。
sen.e: That almost everything (including layout) besides printing and dispatching is done by students' hands and that there are many analytical articles make it distinctive.
That almost everything (including layout) besides printing and dispatching is done by students' hands and that there are many analytical articles make it distinctive.
That almost everything (including layout) except printing and dispatching is done by students' hands and that there are many analytical articles make it distinctive.

sen.j: また、京都大学の新入生向けに入学アルバム（『KYOTO UNIVERSITY FRESH BOOK』）・卒業生向けに卒業アルバム（『KYOTO UNIVERSITY YEAR BOOK』）を毎年発行する。
sen.e: Also, every year it publishes enrollment album for the Kyoto University freshmen ("KYOTO UNIVERSITY FRESH BOOK") and graduation album for the graduates ("KYOTO UNIVERSITY YEAR BOOK").
Also, every year it publishes an enrollment album for the Kyoto University freshmen ("KYOTO UNIVERSITY FRESH BOOK") and graduation album for the graduates ("KYOTO UNIVERSITY YEAR BOOK").

sen.j: 主に京大受験を目指す学生向けに独自の大学情報本も毎年発行していたが、現在は休刊。
sen.e: It was also publishing its own university information book every year mainly for students aiming for the Kyoto University entrance examination, but the publication is currently suspended.
It was also publishing its own university information book every year mainly for students aiming for the Kyoto University entrance examination, but the publication is currently suspended.

sen.j: 京都大学新聞社の同窓会的組織に、現役学生をも含んだ「インテル会」がある。
sen.e: Interu-kai Foundation is an alumni association like organization of Kyoto University Press, which even includes the current students.
Interu-kai Foundation is an alumni association like organization of the Kyoto University Press, which even includes the current students.
Interu-kai Foundation is an alumni association like organization of the Kyoto University Press, which even includes the current students.

sen.j: 「インテル」は活字の行間に入れる薄い鉛板のことで、かつては学生編集員が最初に覚える言葉の一つだった。
sen.e: Interu (Interline) is a thin lead plate that is placed between the vertical spacing of types, and it used to be one of the first words that student editors learned.
Interu (Interline) is a thin lead plate that is placed between the vertical spacing of types, and it used to be one of the first words that student editors learned.

sen.j: 命名者の堀川直義によると、「インテリ」（インテリゲンチャ）と引っかけたという。
sen.e: According to Naoyoshi HORIKAWA who named the organization, he wanted to play with the word 'Inteli' (Intelligence).
According to Naoyoshi HORIKAWA who named the organization, he wanted to play with the word 'Inteli' (Intelligence).

sen.j: 京都大学の歴代総長・名誉教授・現役教員・元教員・学外者など計数十名（物故者を含む）。
sen.e: Total of several dozen such as Kyoto University's successive presidents, honorary professors, active teachers, former teachers, and those outside the academic (including the deceased).
Total of several dozen such as Kyoto University's successive presidents, honorary professors, active teachers, former teachers, and those outside academia (including the deceased).

sen.j: 〒606-8317 京都市左京区吉田 京都大学構内
